fact_check_explanation_title: This video of protesters in London chanting “We’re racist and that’s the way we like it” is fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: The audio has been taken from a video of racist Chelsea fans in Paris in 2015.

fact_check_explanation_title: There were no stabbings reported at protests in London over the weekend
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Met police have confirmed no stabbings happened at the protests.

fact_check_explanation_title: A viral Facebook post about 52 free horses is a repost from 2011
fact_check_explanation_summary: Similar posts have been circulating online since a genuine appeal in 2011.

fact_check_explanation_title: A viral post on autopsies, Italy and the new coronavirus has many inaccuracies
fact_check_explanation_summary: Covid-19 is not caused by bacteria.

fact_check_explanation_title: Half of these images of injured police officers are not from recent Black Lives Matter protests
fact_check_explanation_summary: The images include photos from a pro-Tommy Robinson protest, a far-right protest, and one against David Cameron.

fact_check_explanation_title: This person isn’t the one from viral footage of someone trying to burn the Cenotaph’s Union Jack
Some of these figures comparing the cost of the government job retention scheme to other government spending are wrong.
fact_check_explanation_summary: The furlough scheme is estimated to cost £14 billion per month.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government updated total Covid-19 death data with April and May deaths confirmed by non-NHS labs
fact_check_explanation_summary: The cumulative deaths total increased by 445 more than the daily increase in coronavirus deaths.

fact_check_explanation_title: Be wary of social media posts comparing fatality rates in confirmed Covid-19 cases
fact_check_explanation_summary: These figures don’t count the large numbers of people who’ve had the disease but haven’t been tested.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claim by Independent SAGE about Covid-19 infections in children is based on unclear evidence
fact_check_explanation_summary: Research literature doesn’t suggest that children are as likely as adults to become infected and carry the virus.

fact_check_explanation_title: The limits of what we can say about early lockdowns
fact_check_explanation_summary: Analysis comparing countries’ excess deaths tallies based on when they locked down needs to be put into context.

fact_check_explanation_title: What counts as essential travel during the Covid-19 lockdown?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We were asked by readers to explain what travel is permitted under the new coronavirus guidance.
